013package org.apache.juneau.internal;
014
015import org.apache.juneau.*;
016import org.apache.juneau.common.internal.*;
017
018/**
019 * Represents an OSGi-style version range like <js>"1.2"</js> or <js>"[1.0,2.0)"</js>.
020 *
021 * <p>
022 * The range can be any of the following formats:
023 * <ul>
024 *    <li><js>"[0,1.0)"</js> = Less than 1.0.  1.0 and 1.0.0 does not match.
025 *    <li><js>"[0,1.0]"</js> = Less than or equal to 1.0.  Note that 1.0.1 will match.
026 *    <li><js>"1.0"</js> = At least 1.0.  1.0 and 2.0 will match.
027 * </ul>
028 *
029 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
030 * </ul>
031 */
032public class VersionRange {
033
034   private final Version minVersion, maxVersion;
035   private final boolean minExclusive, maxExclusive;
036
037   /**
038    * Constructor.
039    *
040    * @param range The range string to parse.
041    */
042   public VersionRange(String range) {
043      range = range.trim();
044      if (! range.isEmpty()) {
045         char c1 = range.charAt(0), c2 = range.charAt(range.length()-1);
046         int c = range.indexOf(',');
047         if (c > -1 && (c1 == '[' || c1 == '(') && (c2 == ']' || c2 == ')')) {
048            String v1 = range.substring(1, c), v2 = range.substring(c+1, range.length()-1);
049            minVersion = new Version(v1);
050            maxVersion = new Version(v2);
051            minExclusive = c1 == '(';
052            maxExclusive = c2 == ')';
053         } else {
054            minVersion = new Version(range);
055            maxVersion = null;
056            minExclusive = maxExclusive = false;
057         }
058      } else {
059         minVersion = maxVersion = null;
060         minExclusive = maxExclusive = false;
061      }
062   }
063
064   /**
065    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if the specified version string matches this version range.
066    *
067    * @param v The version string (e.g. <js>"1.2.3"</js>)
068    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the specified version string matches this version range.
069    */
070   public boolean matches(String v) {
071      if (Utils.isEmpty(v))
072         return (minVersion == null && maxVersion == null);
073      Version ver = new Version(v);
074      if ((minVersion != null && ! ver.isAtLeast(minVersion, minExclusive)) || (maxVersion != null && ! ver.isAtMost(maxVersion, maxExclusive)))
075         return false;
076      return true;
077   }
078
079   @Override /* Object */
080   public String toString() {
081      return (minExclusive ? "(" : "[") + minVersion + ',' + maxVersion + (maxExclusive ? ")" : "]");
082   }
083}
